title: Monarch reassures holidaymakers over Greece
text:
The Monarch Group has said it remains “business as usual” in Greece despite the on-going fiscal crisis. Customers wait to use a cash machine in Greece 
The airline and tour operator, which flies to a number of destinations in the country, maintains, “Greece is an excellent place to visit in the summer”. 
A spokesman for The Monarch Group said: “It is very much business as usual with all of our flight and holiday programmes to airports and destinations across Greece operating normally. 
“Our hotel partners are continuing to accept credit cards, and the businesses which our customers use, such as restaurants, are open for business. 
“Like all operators, and in accordance with Foreign Office guidance, we are advising our customers to take enough Euros with them to cover all their holiday needs, as some local businesses may prefer to accept cash payments.” 
Meanwhile, the Foreign Office has updated its travel advice. Following media reports over shortages, the FCO has said that all travellers should make sure they have sufficient medical supplies for the duration of their stay.
